intro: Ligusticopsis deqenensis, commonly known as the Deqen ligusticopsis, is a flowering plant native to the Yunnan Province in China. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in umbels. It thrives in moist, temperate climates and is often found in forested areas. Due to its limited distribution and unique morphology, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
